title: Drawing, "Design for the Corridor to the Chinese Gallery", 1815–19
medium:
Watercolor, graphite on cream wove paper
Support: cream wove paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Vertical rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. In the foreground, one of the divisions of the Gallery trelliswork framing, hung with wooden bells, and surmounted by a section containing an ornamental rectangular painted glass panel. Standards with hanging lanterns on either side. In perspective, at left, the west side of the Gallery is visible. With mantelpiece and niches to left and right containing cabinets on which stand plaster Chinese figures in costume. Staircase in background.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

exhibitions.title: The Art of Decoration: Drawings and Objects from the Collection of the Cooper-Hewitt Museum
